tool.name: Sissrs
tool.command:
sissrs.pl -i $input -o $output -s $genome_size
#if str($amp_bias) == "amp_bias_true": -a #end if
#if str($avglen) != "": -F $avglen #end if
#if str($fdr) != "": -D $fdr #end if
#if str($use_bg.use_bg_check) == "use_bg_check_true": -b '$use_bg.background' -e $use_bg.evalue -p $use_bg.pvalue #end if
#if str($frac_map) != "": -m $frac_map #end if
#if str($winsize) != "": -w $winsize #end if
#if str($min_dir_reads) != "": -E $min_dir_reads #end if
#if str($exclude) != "None": -q '$exclude' #end if
#if str($trans_report) == "trans_report_true": -t #end if
#if str($region_report) == "region_report_true": -r #end if
#if str($cluster_report) == "cluster_report_true": -c #end if
#if str($strand_report) == "strand_report_true": -u #end if

param.name: input
param.label: Bed File from Chip-Seq
param.help: input file containing tags/reads in BED format

param.name: genome_size
param.label: Genome Size (required)
param.help: genome size (number of bases or nucleotides)

param.name: amp_bias
param.label: Only keep one read if multiple align to same coordinate
param.help: only one read is kept if multiple reads align to the same genomic coordinate (minimizes amplification bias)

param.name: avglen
param.label: Average length of DNA frags (default: estimated)
param.help: average length of DNA fragments that were sequenced (default: estimated from reads)

param.name: fdr
param.label: False Discovery Rate
param.help: false discovery rate (default: 0.001) if random background model based on Poisson probabilities need to be used as control

param.name: background
param.label: Background bed file to use as control
param.help: background file containing tags in BED format to be used as control; E-value and P-value can be set to desired values to control specificity and sensitivity, resp.

param.name: evalue
param.label: E-value for expected number of binding sites (only used with background file)
param.help: e-value (>=0); it is the number of binding sites one might expect to infer by chance

param.name: pvalue
param.label: P-value threshold for fold enrichment (only used with background file)
param.help: p-value threshold for fold enrichment of ChIP tags at a binding site location compared to that at the same location in the control data

param.name: frac_map
param.label: Fraction of genome mappable by reads
param.help: fraction of genome mappable by reads (default: 0.8 for hg18, assuming ELAND was used to map the reads; could be different for different organisms and other alignment algorithms)

param.name: winsize
param.label: Scanning Window Size (must be even)
param.help: scanning window size (even number > 1), which controls for noise

param.name: min_dir_reads
param.label: Min number of 'directional' reads
param.help: min number of 'directional' reads required on each side of the inferred binding site (>0)

param.name: dna_frag_len
param.label: Upper-bound on DNA fragment length
param.help: upper-bound on the DNA fragment length

param.name: exclude
param.label: BED file containing regions to exclude
param.help: file containing genomic regions to exclude; reads mapped to these regions will be ignored; file format: 'chr startCoord endCoord'

param.name: trans_report
param.label: Report each binding site as a single coordinate
param.help: reports each binding site as a single genomic coordinate

param.name: region_report
param.label: Report each site as a region
param.help: reports each binding site as an X-bp binding region centered on inferred binding coordinate; X denotes the distance from the start of the right-most red bar to the end of the left-most blue bar surrounding the actual binding site (from paper)

param.name: cluster_report
param.label: Cluster reported sites (default)
param.help: same as the region option, except that it reports binding sites that are clustered within F bp of each other as a single binding region; this is the default option

param.name: strand_report
param.label: Also report sites supported by only sense or only anti-sense strands
param.help: (also) reports binding sites supported only by reads mapped to either sense or anti-sense strand; this option will recover binding sites whose sense or anti-sense reads were not mapped for some reason (e.g., falls in unmappable/repetitive regions)

tool.help:
This tool finds peaks in Chip-Seq data.
Link_ to the SISSRs manual.
.. _Link: http://dir.nhlbi.nih.gov/papers/lmi/epigenomes/sissrs/SISSRs-Manual.pdf
